column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Paint Cleanly
#Text=You can transform a room with a simple paint job , but painting can be messy and leave stains .
#Text=Careful preparations can help you avoid spillage and paint splatter .
#Text=If you want to paint cleanly , follow these tips .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Protect the area you want to paint .
#Text=Preparation is an important part of your plan to paint cleanly .
#Text=You should take certain steps each time you paint to reduce the chance of mishaps .
#Text=Spread heavy drop cloths over the entire floor area .
#Text=Do n't substitute plastic covering to protect floors ; it tends to bunch up when walked on .
#Text=Move lighter furniture out of the room you 're painting .
#Text=Move heavy furniture to the center of the room and cover it completely with plastic covering .
#Text=Remove all wall decorations and area rugs .
#Text=Take down curtains and curtain rods .
#Text=Use masking tape to protect the trim and windows , door frames and baseboards .
#Text=Also tape off fixtures that you ca n't remove .
#Text=Remove wall plates from electrical outlets and light switches .
#Text=Keep the area around the surface you 're painting clear of all obstructions .
#Text=Paint with care .
#Text=You can take steps to greatly reduce the number of accidental spills .
#Text=These steps differ depending on the method you use to paint .
#Text=Roll off excess paint on the roller grid .
#Text=Drops of paint can go unnoticed and set in on surfaces .
#Text=Do n't allow the roller to spin after each stroke .
#Text=Spinning rollers often splatter paint in all directions .
#Text=Use a can roller grid instead of a separate pan .
#Text=Grids that attach inside the paint can reduce paint splatter and also eliminate the need for pans .
#Text=Pans tip over easily and people may accidentally step in them .
#Text=Painting With an Airless Sprayer
#Text=Use care when painting near ceilings or windows .
#Text=Airless sprayers do n't use compressors .
#Text=A pump forces the paint through a high-pressure hose and out the nozzle .
#Text=Although they produce less overspray than a compressed air sprayer , an airless sprayer will produce paint mist that can travel on air currents to areas you do n't want to paint .
#Text=Reduce spillage .
#Text=Use a nail to punch a hole in the rim of the paint can .
#Text=Paint tends to collect on the rim of the can after it 's been poured .
#Text=When the lid is closed , paint seeps outside the can .
#Text=Creating the hole in the rim allows the paint drip back into the can .
#Text=Place the lid back on the paint can , drape a cloth over the can and tap the lid down with a hammer .
#Text=This keeps excess paint from splattering as you tightly close the lid .
#Text=Clean up paint spills immediately .
#Text=Accidents will happen , but their effects can be ameliorated if you act quickly .
#Text=Oil-based Paints
#Text=Hard floor and carpets .
#Text=Spill on hard floor : Dampen paper towels with mineral spirits and blot the spill before it dries .
#Text=Spill on carpeting : Use the same method as you would use on a hard floor .
#Text=It is important to have mineral spirits or paint thinner available beforehand when working with oil-based paints .
#Text=Water-based Paints
#Text=Hard floor and carpets .
#Text=Spill on hard floor : Use damp paper towels to sop up the spill .
#Text=Spill on carpeting :
#Text=Position paper towels around the spill .
#Text=Drench the stain with water and soak up the mixture with clean paper towels .
#Text=Continue to douse and blot the stained area until the towels show no sign of color .
#Text=Consider using a carpet-cleaning product to remove the last remnants of paint .
#Text=Things You 'll Need
#Text=Drop cloths
#Text=Plastic covering
#Text=Masking tape
#Text=Can roller grid
#Text=Hammer and nail
#Text=Mineral spirits or water
#Text=Paper towels
